DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective ass effect fish oil-enriched enteral parenteral nutrition blood oxygenation critically ill patient .
DOC.brief_title: Parenteral Nutrition With Intravenous Oral Fish Oil Intensive Care Patients
DOC.criteria: Inclusion : sign informed consent mechanicallyventilated adult ( age 1880 ) admit Intensive Care Unit , enteral nutrition meet nutrition goal ( least 80 % rest energy expenditure ) within past 36 hour APACHE II score median value intensive care unit ( id est > 20 ) Exclusion : resuscitate status cardiogenic pulmonary edema previous ( < 1 month ) ongoing need corticosteroid > 0.1 mg/kg prednisolon equivalent immune suppressive treatment serum triglyceride > 300 mg/dl screen alteration coagulation ( platelet < 100.000 mm3 ) , PTT > 60 sec , INR ≥ 2.5 without therapeutic intervention pregnancy participation clinical study investigational drug within one month prior start clinical trial know suspected drug abuse general contraindication infusion therapy acute pulmonary oedema , hyperhydration decompensated cardiac insufficiency know hypersensitivity egg , soy , fish protein ingredient autoimmune disease HIV uncompensated hemodynamical failure origin ( hemorrhagic shock , myocardial infarction , cardiac failure ) uncompensated ketoacidosis cause Diabetes mellitus within 7 day prior onset study uncompensated renal insufficiency serum creatinine > 1.5 mg/dL ( > 133 µmol/L ) patient severe liver dysfunction bilirubin > 2.5 mg/dL ( > 43 µmol/L ) necrotizing pancreatitis
DOC.keyword: critically ill , mechanically ventilated patient require enteral parenteral nutritional support
